intro: Hieracium glaucinum subsp. lojkae, commonly known as the Lojka's hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its rosette growth habit and features narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the dandelion family. It is native to Central Europe and thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
